snippet: Large numbers of students failed the state exams, which were aligned with a more rigorous set of standards known as the Common Core.
abstract: Education officials report that number of New York students passing state reading and math exams dropped drastically in 2013, unsettling parents, principals and teachers; large numbers of students failed state exams, which were aligned with more rigorous set of standards known as Common Core.

byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and ROBERT GEBELOFF
byline.contributor: Michaelle Bond, E. C. Gogolak and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Large numbers of students failed the state exams, which were aligned with a more rigorous set of standards known as the Common Core.

headline.main: Test Scores Sink as New York Adopts Tougher Benchmarks
headline.print_headline: Test Scores Sink As State Adopts New Benchmarks
